chapter.title: project
chapter.p: is a framework for experimenting with automated querying of various data sources (such as search engines), processing search results and their visualization.
was primarily built with search results clustering in mind, but it can be easily configured to do other, interesting things.

chapter.title: Feedback and news
chapter.p: All news and other messages are distributed using a mailing list at SourceForge: carrot2-developers@lists.sourceforge.net.
Please direct your questions or concerns to the mailing list (subscription is required to limit spam).

chapter.title: Demos
chapter.p: See our demo applications for search results clustering.

chapter.title: Commercial Carrot2 Spin-off
chapter.p: Carrot2 framework is used in a commercial spin-off company called Carrot Search. We are very devoted to our open source framework and we use it extensively in our production installations.

The commercial company provides consulting services, installation, maintenance and text clustering expertise, but most of all an rewritten and much faster version of the open source Lingo algorithm. If you need performance, hierarchical clustering, ontologies and much advanced tuning capabilities, see Carrot Search Web site for contant information.
